DOC.brief_title: Nurse Counseling Physical Activity Primary Care Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Many elderly primary care patient high risk health complication functional impairment due low level physical activity . Previous trial counsel elderly patient primary care clinic demonstrate lasting physical activity change evaluate fitness change associate increased activity . Objectives : The primary objective determine nurse telephone counseling could assist 60 80 year old VA primary care patient establish maintain regular walking program . Methods : In randomized clinical trial , 60-80 year old patient refer walk program primary care provider . All participant receive individualized counseling nurse , next year , one three follow-up intervention : 1 ) 20 call initiated nurse ; 2 ) ten call initiated nurse ten initiate automate telephone message delivery system ; 3 ) follow-up call . All keep walk diary mail data collector blind intervention group . Follow-up research visit schedule six 12 month . Self-reported walking , primary outcome measure , assess walk diary validate report significant others accelerometer data . Improvement fitness assess 12 month standardize six minute walk test . Tinetti mobility score , body mass index , body girth also assess . Several quality life measure also administer . Status : Complete .
